chapter.title: WKT Raster Reference
chapter.para: The functions given below are the ones which a user of WKT Raster is likely to need and which are currently available in WKT Raster. There are other functions which are required support functions to the raster objects which are not of use to a general user.

WKT Raster is a sub-project of PostGIS that introduces a new type called raster for storing and analyzing raster data. In order to use these functions, you need PostGIS 1.4 above installed in your database as well as wktraster compiled and the rtpostgis.sql loaded in your database. This will change later once the two projects are fully integrated.
For more information about WKT Raster, please refer to PostGIS WKT Raster Home Page.
For the examples in this reference we will be using a raster table of dummy rasters - Formed with the following code
chapter.programlisting: CREATE TABLE dummy_rast(rid integer, rast raster); INSERT INTO dummy_rast(rid, rast) VALUES (1, ('01' -- little endian (uint8 ndr) || '0000' -- version (uint16 0) || '0000' -- nBands (uint16 0) || '0000000000000040' -- scaleX (float64 2) || '0000000000000840' -- scaleY (float64 3) || '000000000000E03F' -- ipX (float64 0.5) || '000000000000E03F' -- ipY (float64 0.5) || '0000000000000000' -- skewX (float64 0) || '0000000000000000' -- skewY (float64 0) || '00000000' -- SRID (int32 0) || '0A00' -- width (uint16 10) || '1400' -- height (uint16 20) )::raster ), -- Raster: 5 x 5 pixels, 3 bands, PT_8BUI pixel type, NODATA = 0 (2, ('01000003009A9999999999A93F9A9999999999A9BF000000E02B274A' || '41000000007719564100000000000000000000000000000000FFFFFFFF050005000400FDFEFDFEFEFDFEFEFDF9FAFEF' || 'EFCF9FBFDFEFEFDFCFAFEFEFE04004E627AADD16076B4F9FE6370A9F5FE59637AB0E54F58617087040046566487A1506CA2E3FA5A6CAFFBFE4D566DA4CB3E454C5665')::raster);

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns an empty raster of given dimensions, pixel x y, skew and spatial reference system with no bands

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the value that represents no data for the band

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the value in a given band that represents no data.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the value that represents no data for the band

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT ST_BandNoDataValue(rast,1) As bnval1, ST_BandNoDataValue(rast,2) As bnval2, ST_BandNoDataValue(rast,3) As bnval3 FROM dummy_rast WHERE rid = 2;
bnval1 | bnval2 | bnval3 --------+--------+-------- 0 | 0 | 0

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the type of pixel for given band.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the value that represents no data for the band

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT ST_BandPixelType(rast,1) As btype1, ST_BandPixelType(rast,2) As btype2, ST_BandPixelType(rast,3) As btype3 FROM dummy_rast WHERE rid = 2;
btype1 | btype2 | btype3 --------+--------+-------- 8BUI | 8BUI | 8BUI

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the box 2d representation of the enclosing box of the raster

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the box representing the extent of the raster.
The polygon is defined by the corner points of the bounding box ((MINX, MINY), (MAXX, MAXY))

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the polygon representation of the extent of the raster.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the polygon representation of the extent of the raster in spatial coordinate units defiend by srid. It is a float8 minimum bounding box represented as a polygon.
The polygon is defined by the corner points of the bounding box ((MINX, MINY), (MINX, MAXY), (MAXX, MAXY), (MAXX, MINY), (MINX, MINY))

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the georeference meta data in GDAL or ESRI format. Default is GDAL.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the georeference meta data in GDAL or ESRI format. Default is GDAL if no type specified. type is string 'GDAL' or 'ESRI'.
Difference between format representations is as follows:
GDAL: pixelsizex skewy skewx pixelsizey upperleftx upperlefty
ESRI: pixelsizex skewy skewx pixelsizey upperleftx + pixelsizex*0.5 upperlefty + pixelsizey*0.5

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the height of the raster in pixels?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the height of the raster.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT rid, ST_Height(rast) As rastheight FROM dummy_rast;
rid | rastheight -----+------------ 1 | 20 2 | 5

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the number of bands in the raster object.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the number of bands in the raster object.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT rid, ST_NumBands(rast) As numbands FROM dummy_rast;
rid | numbands ----+---------- 1 | 0 2 | 3

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the x size of pixels in units of coordinate reference system?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the x size of pixels in units of coordinate reference system?

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT rid, ST_PixelSizeX(rast) As rastpixwidth FROM dummy_rast;
rid | rastpixwidth -----+-------------- 1 | 2 2 | 0.05

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the y size of pixels in units of coordinate reference system?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the y size of pixels in units of coordinate reference system?

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT rid, ST_PixelSizeY(rast) As rastpixheight FROM dummy_rast;
rid | rastpixheight -----+--------------- 1 | 3 2 | -0.05 --this might be a bug

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the spatial reference identifier of the raster as defined in spatial_ref_sys table.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the spatial reference identifier of the raster object as defined in the spatial_ref_sys table.

note.para: From PostGIS 2.0+ the srid of a non-georeferenced raster/geometry is 0 instead of the prior -1.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT ST_SRID(rast) As srid FROM dummy_rast WHERE rid=1;
srid ---------------- 0

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the value of a given band in a given columnx, rowy pixel. Band numbers start at 1.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the value of a given band in a given columnx, rowy pixel. Band numbers start at 1.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the width of the raster in pixels?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the width of the raster.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
SELECT ST_Width(rast) As rastwidth FROM dummy_rast WHERE rid=1;
rastwidth ---------------- 10

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return the Well-Known Binary (WKB) representation of the raster without SRID meta data.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the Binary representation of the raster. There are 2 variants of the function. The first variant takes no endian encoding paramater and defaults to little endian. The second variant takes a second argument denoting the encoding - using little-endian ('NDR') or big-endian ('XDR') encoding.
This is useful in binary cursors to pull data out of the database without converting it to a string representation.
